reviewText: Season 3 of the WPT, POker was still HOT!The episodes are just as great here in season 3 as the first 2.This was the last year of hostess Shana Hyatt.This is Not a complete season (unlike 1-2 are complete) but a "Best of" and its well worth the money.The WPT may have lost some flair over the years as more and more poeple now play poker and we dont get to see out favorite pros make the final tables much anymore but now each week its a bunch of new boring 'no names". But season 3 you still had the pros making the final tables, very fun to watch!
summary: the last season with Shana...the last Great season of WPT

Title: N/A

reviewText: i pretty much buy any poker dvd's i can get my hands on, and season 2 was probably the best set i own. 14 episodes, 4 commentaries (2 with antonio esfandiari and phil laak, 2 with daniel negreanu and erick lindgren) which i thought would be nothing special, but in hindsight, i think they're great. i thought that as the prizemoney for the events increased, so too would the quality of the dvd box set, but lo and behold, they cut it down to 8 episodes and include a few paltry deleted hands as "extras". pretty pitiful. if they knew anything about the addictive nature of poker players, they would realise that we want to immerse ourselves with as much detail as possible. give us all 16 episodes with 16 commentaries as well as deleted hands. i want it all, and i'd gladly pay for it. what they did with season 3 was pretty limp.i noticed that the w.s.o.p 2004 dvd set was a 3 disc set with a commentary from greg raymer, not mention tons of other footage on disc 3, which was a big improvement on the 2003 edition. i'm expecting their 2005 dvd to be even better. i hope the wpt learns something from them.i actually prefer watching the wpt events, i think their quality is superior to the w.s.o.p , but the dvd for season 3 was a big letdown. i know sometimes "less is more" , but with dvd box sets, and especially poker dvd's , "MORE IS MORE". i think if season 4 has 8 episodes out of 16, with no commentaries, i probably won't buy it, and stick with the w.s.op. 2005 dvd instead, and just watch the wpt events on fox here in australia.my suggestion, put on every episode, get as many of the players (preferably the winner, or anyone with a bit of charisma and personality, to do a 2 man commentary), the deleted hands i could take or leave, maybe even show some key hands that were turning points from earlier in the tournament that enabled some of the final table players to make it there, and show who was unlucky to miss out. treat your fans with respect and love, and you won't lose them. another season 3 dvd imitation is NOT the way to go. it's pretty damning when something from 2004 was better quality and done better than something from 2005.
summary: if it's not broken , don't fix it
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a big fan of the World Poker Tour. I was disappointed at the product they have released here. The "best of" obviously indicates they have left episodes out, so you are not getting the complete season. They did not include player commentary like they did in Season 2, so that was a bummer. I was really looking forward to that. You get 7 episodes and the WPT championship.The extras here are 1 minutes of Shana Hiatt bloopers. One single minute and it is listed as one of their main extras?? Some of the episodes have a couple of deleted hands you can view. Nothing to get too excited about.The episodes included are great. Unlike most products, this one is worse than the previous seasons. I figured this season  would be loaded even more than last season. I guess they saved a buck by leaving out episodes and not paying for the player commentaries.I gave it 4 stars because the WPT is the best poker on television and you are getting 8 action packed shows on 4 DVDs. Not as good as the 8 DVD set last season, but it is still good. The downside is the season is not complete and the extra features are not that great.
summary: Not as Good as the last Two Seasons
Title: N/A

reviewText: I too was disappointed to find out that only 8 of the 16 episodes would be included on the so-called 'Best of Season 3 WPT' Dvd set.I then taped the other episodes not on the DVDs from Canadian Tv,which only starting airing them about a month before the DVD release anyway.I was curious to see the extra deleted hands not shown on tv so I gave in and bought it.There are only 8 extra hands(a 9th one listed on the DVD case for the Bay 101 episode sadly isn't included unless it's only viewable somewhere within the episode).It's good that for each of the 8 extra (deleted from tv) hands,the dvd allows you to watch them separately before each episode(just by selecting them from a menu)or embedded within the actual episodes.These 8 deleted hands included on the dvd are as follows:One from the Grand Prix de Paris(featuring Tony G.);Two from Foxwoods' World Poker Finals;Three from the World Poker Open(Tunica MS)and Two from the Borgata Poker Open(Atlantic City)episode.Also not listed anywhere on the box or cases is the fact that the final WPT World Championship episode(from Las Vegas)includes(embedded within the actual episode)about an extra 40 minutes of hands(including some from the heads-up action) not shown on the 2 hour(actually only about 90 minutes of show and 30 minutes of commercials)Canadian Tv version(if the Travel channel in the States only aired a 2 hour Tv version than Americans will also be seeing the extra 40 minutes for the first time).This greatly added to my enjoyment of this episode and it runs about 2 hours and 11 minutes in total.As well,the box says there are 16 Poker Corners but actually there are 18 of them totalling about 32 minutes in length(you can watch them all separately or some are also embedded within the 8 episodes included on the Dvd).Strangely again,there were no subtitles for any of the DVD episodes even though the actual Canadian Tv broadcasts had closed captioning available(sometimes I'm just not sure what Scotty Nguyen is saying without them-though neither is the closed captioner sometimes).I also enjoyed the brief but funny(about Fifty of them in total-most if not all, being different from the ones shown at the end of the Season 2 episodes)Shana Hiatt bloopers(1:49 in total length),with my favorite ones showcasing Scotty Nguyen flirting with Shana Hiatt(just priceless) and Shana swearing(even though they bleeped it all but the S*** word,we can still read lips).If this Dvd set had all the episodes and at least one commentary I'd give this 5 stars,instead of the 3 I'm giving it now.If they do another 'Best Of' Dvd set I doubt even I will buy it!I'm not bluffing,or am I?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have Season 2 and Season 3 and liked Season 3 the best.  Instead of the WSOP drifting from table to table, this DVD set follows each table to the end which makes it easier to become engaged in the action and there is plenty of action. I also find the 2 commentators in the WPT better than WSOP.Great dvd set and worth the money.
